betterquesting:10.desc:8:
Hello Player and welcome to §aGregtech - Other Worlds§f! This pack is made as a collaborative effort of the GTOW team, and credit is given to each member of the team on the packs main page.
This modpack is made mostly off the mod §e§eGregtech Community Edition Unofficial§0§0§f and so there is some expertise of Gregtech recommended, however players of all skill levels can still enjoy the pack!
Check the box to begin playing!

§4§cSleeping has been disabled in this pack, §fyou should keep this in mind before having your entire base be above the ground and blown up by a stray creeper.
Take a night vision potion for your troubles, you're sure to need it.

You may notice that you have less hearts than usual, that's intended. This pack has §eSpice of Life §fand that means §ayour health can be increased from eating a variety of foods.
§f§cBe warned! Eating too much of the same food in a row may have negative consequences...
You've gone through most of this song and dance before, break some trees and get some wood.
Crafting Tables are not attainable yet, so you must use the Basic Worktable. §d§a§aThis can only craft recipes that can be made in a basic worktable §f§aand some recipes §amay take tools to complete.
Your first tools will not be wood or stone, they must be flint. Flint will not naturally drop from gravel, §ayou have to craft it into flint shards.

There are many plants and species of flora in this world, you should grab some of the most important resources you can from them.
You obtain §awildroot, seeds and plant fibers §ffrom §ebreaking grass, §fand §astring §fcan be obtained from §eflax plants.

The §asmall flint hatchet §fdoesn't actually have much use as a hatchet, but it is an important beginner crafting item. 
Additionally, the §asmall flint file§f will also end up being used in early recipes. There are also other flint tools that will have to be made, but those will come up when they have to, and they're all exceedingly simple to craft.

The §b§e§aArtisan's Flint Hatchet§f is only good at crafting, for chopping down actual trees it's rather bad. Make a §aFlint Hatchet §fthat is far better at doing that.
It has a small durability, so to repair it you can make §aFlint Sharpening Kits

For better tools, you are going to need §aactual flint, §fno more dinky flint shards. The way that you can get flint is by §emortaring gravel...§f No not the silly gregtech recipe! The one in §eartisans worktables.
§fFlint will become a very useful asset in the future, so stock up on some gravel.

With a §achopping block §fand §aflint hatchet§f in hand, you can now go and chip chop your way to some §e§b§awooden planks!
§fThe chopping block is an §ein world crafting station,§f when you place a log on it with right clock it will appear on the stump. Hitting the chopping block with right click using your axe will slowly break apart the log, eventually returning planks!
The Flint Hatchet returns §conly two planks for each log.
To get planks, you'll need a §achopping block.§f It's nothing more than a log with a hatchet
With your newfound planks, you can make §achests§f with ease! Finally a place to put all those seeds...
The time of using your hands is over, you can make a §aflint pickaxe and shovel§f now!
I don't know what else to say here. Grab §acobblestone.

betterquesting:10.name:8: Light That Fire Up In The Night
betterquesting:10.desc:8:
The §acampfire§f is an essential tool in any plane of survival. It can cook and is a most invaluable light source, especially in a world so dark.
To make it, §bplace tinder on the ground and click on it with logs to surround it (8 Logs is the max), then use the flint and tinder on the campfire for it to be lit.§f Tada! A perfect campfire!
The logs will slowly disappear after some time, so you'll have to end up replenishing them by clicking on it again.

§aTinder §fis a handy combination of §edry plant fibers and sticks§f that can be used as a very flammable material.
Also, you should try to find some §b§ewheat to make straw. §fIt's a easier way of making it, but it's far from required.

With your newfound chopping stump and wooden planks, you should attempt to make a §adrying rack. §fIt allows you to turn §eplant fibers into dry plant fibers,§f which is a more consistent source of twine.
§fIt also will be necessary for making paper later on.
Not able to find §e§benough spare flax? §fNeed some §bwheat to turn into straw? §fJust start farming! §aMattock§f is a simple craft, and there's not really anything more to it.

The §aPit Kiln§f is a way to fire up objects early on, it can be used to make §eclay tools§f and it can §esmelt cobblestone into stone. §fYou'll end up using both of these.
To use it, §bplace down the kiln in the ground and then place the object you want to fire on top of it. Cover it with a Straw Bale and then place wood on top of it.§f Lighting it on fire will start the process of burning the item. §e§bYou can burn up to 8 of the same item at once in a single pit kiln§f.
§b§eThe Pit Kiln must be surrounded on all sides for it to work.

§dTip! You should run around 6 to 8 of these things this early on. Before you get stone machines it's the only way to make smooth stone or clay tools. If you're feeling cheap however, make just enough for a stone kiln and make the rest of your smooth stone using that.

The §aGranite Anvil§f is an item that can be used to break down stone blocks. It is used to make §estone slabs and mason bricks.
§fThe Stone and Stone Slabs can be fired in a pit kiln, §c§bcobblestone slabs must be crafted using the worktable recipe.

§aMason brick§f are a vital component in your earliest of early machines. It allows for the Workstation to be crafting, and allows for §estone inventions§f to be made.
To make mason bricks, you have to §ebreak stone brick slabs on an anvil using a pickaxe. §fStone bricks must be made in a worktable using a artisan chisel.

§bWant to carry fluids? Want to defend your house?§f You need to get into pottery.
Making §aunfired bricks§f are fairly easy, §ethey take clay and a wooden form.§f You can then fire them in a kiln of some kind and get the properly fired version of it.
Make §aa clay bucket,§f you'll need it eventually. §aClay Shears §fare required as well

§dJust because this quest takes only the pit quest does not mean you need to do it right now, you can also make the clay buckets in the stone kiln and do it after the stone machines quest.

The §abasic workstation§f is an important crafting station that allows the use of §btwo artisan tools in order to craft an item.
§f§bIt can do all of the recipes a regular worktable can do,§f but now has storage for tools and can accept two tools for a single recipe.
Most masonry and stone machines take two tools to craft, so this is used a lot.

The §aStone Kiln, Stone Oven, and Stone Sawmill§f are slightly more efficient versions of their non-stone counterparts. They are powered by §e§b§eburning logs or other fuels in their lower slot.
§fOn top of the standard recipes, they also have some special recipes that can §eonly be made in improved versions of the machines. § §fAdditionally, they can process §b16 items at once §fwhich is double that of the pit kiln.
§fFor this quest you'll craft §ball three of them,§f don't worry, you will use them all. Additionally it also has you get a §aflint sawblade§f for the sawmill.

The §aCharcoal Pit§f is a §bmultiblock §ffrom Pyrotech that will turn §c§e§blog piles into charcoal, §famong other things.
It works fairly similarly to the §echarcoal pit from Forestry,§f if you've ever used it. §bAll sides have to be surrounded by dirt/grass except for the bottom, which can be stone drains.
§fLight one of the top logs and then cover it with dirt or grass again and wait, if you did it right §e§bthe structure should continue smoking.§f Once it has stopped smoking you are able to open it again and §ebreak the ash,§f leaving you with charcoal.
§eStone basins at the bottom can collect fluid from the process.§f Namely §awood tar, §fwhich can be used later.
All of the ingredients here will be required for a good multiblock, §bthe wood log count can be increased though.

§dIt has to be log piles, regular logs wont do. Drains only pull out from collecters in a 3x3 area behind them. If you do not have fluid storage you can pull wood tar straight out of the drain and/or collectors.

§aSugarcane §fis a valuable crop that can be used to satisfy your sweet tooth or, more importantly, §ecraft paper§f.
You'll want a lot of Sugarcane soon enough, so start growing it early!

Tired of having to constantly replace your flint tools? You can make §amasons tools! §fThey have §emore durability §fand you can craft most of the same tools as you can flint tools.
Some mason tools you still can't make, however.
§aBoards §fare durable, lightweight, applications of wood. They are essential for many constructs and are gotten from §esawing wooden slabs.

§aWood Tar§f is a byproduct of running the charcoal pit, it can be a useful crafting component for strengthening certain wood materials.
§dThis Wood Tar may look different, but it's the exact same

§aPaper§f is a versatile ingredient with many properties. Because of this omniusability, it's not going to be easy to make.
The first goal is to get §echad §fby mortaring some sugar cane. You then must §esoak it in a water pot for several minutes.§f Once you have the soaked chad you can combine it into §epulp.§f §aPulp is then dried into paper.
§fIt's not an especially difficult process, however you will need a lot of chad for the paper§f, so make sure to have ample amounts of sugarcane.

Welcome to the world of fluid crafting! The §aSoaking Pot §fallows you to soak items in it for some time in order for them to §eturn into different items.
§fThe liquids you'll be using early on are mostly going to be water and wood tar, so the §bbucket will not be breaking.
§fKeep in mind that water is finite in the pack.

Make some §adurable string or tarred boards/anything else with wood tar§f to complete this quest.
In order to soak these items correctly, you have to §bplace the soaking pot above a campfire, §fother than that it's the same.
§d
§dOnly the Tarred Planks, Boards, and String are used much, don't worry about the rest. You only need any one of these items.

Finally, now that you have paper, you can make §ablank patterns §ffor §eTinker's Construct§f!
Patterns do have some other uses too, but you'll mostly need them for stencils and the like. §bYou should probably make a sugar cane farm for that. These get expensive.

With your newfound patterns, you can make the §atables from tinker's construct!§f These allow you to make some invaluable §ecrafting components §ffor further on.
§bWhere's the tool station you ask? Don't worry about that silly thing!

The §aArtisan's workshop§f is a 5x5 artisan table that can use three tools, blah blah, we don't care about that. The good thing about the Basic Workshop is that it can craft §eactual normal crafting table recipes.
§fEvery other artisan's worktable is unable to craft recipes from the normal §lCrafting§f JEI tab. The Basic Workshop is not limited by that, and you are §efree to craft whatever you'd like.
§fAlso some future things may require the §e5x5 grid or the three tools,§f i.e. Refractory stuff.

For your regular selection of tools, you're going to be using gregtech ones. Your first set of GT tools you can make for general usage are §aflint tools.§f
Your previous flint tools are Tinker's flint tools, which do work, however, they do not have the §ecorrect harvest level to mine any ore.§c You have to use gregtech.

So, you're able to mine now ay? Well Mining is a little bit different here, so let's get into that.
First off, §aonly Gregtech ores spawn.§f There's no minecraft ores, no mekanism ores, just gregtech. And gregtech doesn't do regular ore veins. No it has §b§aore VEINS.§f
Each vein is often around two chunks wide with hundreds of ores in each. These veins have up to four types of ores: primary, seconday, between, and sporadic. Basically upper layers are primary and bottom layers are secondary.
Each vein spawns every three chunks. To find out where a vein is take the X and Z chunk coordinate (i.e. the chunk you are in on the chunk grid) and if both values are a multiple of 3n+1, it's an ore vein.
Good luck digging!

The §aGregtech Mortar§f is basically just a better version of the artisan's mortar. It can make chad, sugar, and clay dust as well as §emaking flint for only one gravel instead of three.
§fThe §aGregtech Hammer and File §fare other Gregtech tools that will also be used for crafting eventually, you can make the hammer out of §eMasonry Bricks and the file out of large stone plates§f. There is also a §amining hammer§f, made from large stone plates, that mines in a 3x3 area.

Your next goal is to get §aglass,§f which is a somewhat investive endeavor.
In order to make glass you must §esmelt glassy sand in a kiln (not pit). §fGlassy sand is made with two glass dust and two sand. The Glass dust is made with quartz sand (ground up sand) and small piles of flint.

§dBecause of the chance for failure, make a few of these at a time. Kilns can run up to 16 items at once.

You have been missing one stone machine for too long, the §astone crucible! §fThis will allow you to melt things using the power of hotness.
It takes a lot of mason bricks and some newly obtainable glass to craft.

You have unlocked the secrets of the craft, no longer can you merely just work with mason tools, you have become a true mason. You understand stone like it's a living creature... maybe it is one?
You have unlocked the skill to craft the §amason's workshop. §fUse it wisely.

Do you have a lot of clay balls? Do you not know what to do with them? Fear not, the §acompacting bin §fwill save you! §eJust by putting they clay into the bin and hitting it with a shovel you can get clay blocks!§f Efficiency!

With your bloomery, you can now turn §ecopper into a §a§ebloom, §fbreaking it on a granite anvil with a bloom hammer will allow you to get copper! §aIn... nugget form.§f
Wait? You want copper ingots? §bIt's gonna take a bit more than that to do it...

The §aBloomery§f is the first way of smelting any ores, and it is baaaaaad at it.
It requires the ore (or dust) to be placed into the §btop first, and then fuel put on top of that. You then light the top on fire and it starts. §fIt is verrrrrrrry slow, however can be sped up using §abellows §fplaced next to it.
Once it's finished you will get a bloom. This bloom should be §bpicked up with tongs and then placed onto an anvil,§f where you can then smash it with a §abloom hammer (like the mason one) §fgetting §eslag, nuggets, and dust in the process.§f
Be careful! The bloom is very hot and may start a fire!

betterquesting:10.name:8: Bricks, Bricks, Bricks, and more Bricks!
betterquesting:10.desc:8:
Further technology? Well guess how we'll get that, we need more and more bricks! For the next bit of progression we'll be using §aseared and refractory bricks,§f so grab yourself both of those!
The recipes both take fluids, and so can §conly be made in the basic workshop.§f Both take clay dust, which can be gotten from mortaring clay blocks. §eYou can make clay blocks with a compacting bin or in a workshop as well.

Finally finding the tools to mine, you set off, and look for the ores you can utilize... Of which there is basically only one. Yep, for even minor progression onwards you need to get §acopper.§f
Don't fret! Copper is not a rare metal at all, in fact there are §equite a few sources for it!§f §bAll of them can be turned into copper ingots with no processing, but some are easier to find than others.§f
I'd recommend finding a source of §dchalcopyrite or tetrahedrite.

To make refractory machines, we're going to need a strong and durable material to help keep the bricks together. You need §aRefractory Mortar
§fCombining §edark ash which can be made from slag and some other miscellaneous dusts§f, you can get a blend which when thrown into water will make a durable foundation material for further refractory machines.

Foundrys take molds, so let's make some §amolds.
§fTo start off, you'll need a §e§amold crafting station,§f with that you can then craft some refractory clay blocks and put them in along with some fuel. §eMake it into a certain shape and then fire it.
§fOnce you have your raw ingot mold, you'll want to place it into a §acast§f. Another easy recipe.

Well, you now have copper nuggets, let's turn those into ingots.
You cannot just manually combine copper nuggets into an ingot, that's dumb, you need to melt it and then cast it into an ingot. For this you'll need a§a Foundry§f.
Place the §aburner heater§f down and then place a §amelting crucible§f on top of it. §eStick a fuel into the burner heater and your nuggets into the crucible. §fNext place a §arefractory spout§f to the side of the crucible and an§a ingot cast §fdirectly under it.
Congrats! You now have a foundry!
Make some§a copper §fwith your newfound Foundry!
Make some §acopper plates§f! Good for the Refractory Machines
Copper isn't the only metal you can make! Using the bloomery and foundry you can make §aTin Ingots §fand §aLead Ingots§f. Nothing else though, tin and lead is it! So make that tin and lead!
Make §aCopper Artisan's Tools§f for more durability!
A §amechanical bellow §fcan be used to §eautomate the processes of a bellow,§b it requires a cog to function,§f but now with it you can multitask!

Are you tired of your old stone machines? Think that they're rather boring? Well fear not, you can make faster and better §arefractory machines with copper plates!
§fRealistically, You'll only really use the §ecrucible and sawmill. §fThe §d§ekiln and oven §fdo have their own uses, but otherwise will likely go to the §aSeared Furnace
§fRefractory Machines now run §b64 items at once instead of 16, making them 4x better.

betterquesting:10.name:8: How Much Tin Could A Potin Tin?
betterquesting:10.desc:8: §aPotin§f is a very easily producable alloy with some pretty handy purposes. It just takes copper, tin, and lead, and it is §ethe best material for pipes§f for a fairly significantly long while. Additionally it's required for the §aAlloying Crucible.
§eRefractory Crucibles§f can get hot enough to melt cobblestone into §alava, §fa very useful feature! Grab some lava, but be warned because it'll set you on fire while holding it!

The §aSeared Furnace§f is the first form of Furnace-ry in the entire pack. And now, you can make it. It is costly, but with the quicker refractory machines it will be exceedingly possible.
The quest here is for the §esmallest possible 3x3x3.§b Effectively it is a straight cube of seared bricks but the top and bottom only need the middle block and the middle layer needs to have both the tank and controller.
§fYou can make seared furnaces with bigger interiors, which will allow for more items to be smelted at once.

Some alloys are too difficult to mix by hand, mixing them as a liquid is a much better idea. Hence you need an §aalloying crucible§f!
This takes fluid inputs from the top, so what you can do is have a §bfoundry's refractory spout directly over it and just let the liquid run into it that you want to alloy.§f
To cast the resulting ingot out into an alloy, §bjust attach another spout to the crucible and pour it into a cast§f.
By combining 3 §ecopper§f and 1 §etin§f in an alloying crucible you can make 4 §abronze§f, show off what you can make!
Make yourself a §abronze pickaxe§f! You have just advanced up a mining tier!

You probably like your log pile burning quite a bit, and it's very good don't get me wrong, but you can't really use a pit to get coal coke, for that you need a §acoke oven§f.
It's a 3x3x3 multiblock, §eyou can have a hatch or not it doesn't matter§f, §blook in JEI for how to build it.
§fNow if only you had coal...

You have just made your first coal coke/charcoal, congratulations! Unfortunately you have just made a little bit of waste, some §acreosote oil§f§e.
Show me that you made that and I'll tell you what to do with it.

So. You have creosote. You can use it as a pretty good furnace fuel... if you had a furnace. But there is another option for how to use it, you can make §atreated wood.
§fTreated wood is a more durable form of wood that can be used in construction and making some crafting parts. Most notably§e, worktables.

Finite water must have been really, really, really annoying so far. No worries, the era of finite water is over! §aNow you can pump it out of the ground!§f
§eConstruct it as shown in JEI§f, water can be pulled out of the output using pipes. In certain biomes the pump gets a boost, §bbest biome is the river/ocean.

With a bronze pickaxe you can now mine §airon§f, and there are a PLETHORA of sources to get iron from! (some you may have found already!)
Most notably is the §elimonite vein,§f 3/4 of the ores in it smelt into iron, but there is also the §emagnetite vein§f, and a §echalcopyrite vein §fcan have some iron ores.
Smelt it, and get a start!
Ya ya §airon artisan's tools§f, you get the idea.
With Iron you can make a better §apickaxe§f that can mine more ores.

You are starting to enter the technological era, and so you need yourself §asome tools for the job.§f
Technically, you can still use stone for these tools but I severly don't recommend it, §euse Iron or Bronze (probably iron)§f.

With your tool collection fully satisfied, you're able to craft the ultimate item of Tier 0. §aThe Small Solid Fuel Boiler§f.
Putting fuel into it will cause it to boil water, §cmake sure to not put fuel in it while it's dry! Else it'll all go kablooey.

betterquesting:10.name:8: To The Root Of It All
betterquesting:10.desc:8: Make the §aPyre§f! This block can be§e lit ablaze and make certain recipe§f§es.§f It is an essential item to the earliest of the earliest of roots, and required for advances in Herbology.

Tired of the alloying crucible? Annoyed that it's almost unbearably clunky to use? Clunk no more, with the §aSteam Alloy Smelter§f!

The Steam Alloy Smelter will allow you to make bronze and other early alloys with very minimal effort, no more convoluted foundry setups, now it's just 3 copper and 1 tin. Much more efficient!
I don't know why you would make this. Is it slightly more efficient? Kind of. You'll use this for some multiblocks though so this quest will probably get completed.

Steam Machines use a looooooooooot of steam, so you're going to want some backup steam that you can use. You need some §astorage options§f.
There's two main ones, the §aWooden Multiblock Tank §for the §aTinker Tank§f. There's also drums but those are... less useful. §eThe wooden multiblock tank stores 250 buckets§f and pretty nicely at that, it's also relatively inexpensive, mostly just costing iron and wood. §eIt also automatically outputs fluids using a valve at the bottom.
§fThe Tinker Tank takes seared bricks, which may be slightly more expensive, and also takes a lot of glass. However, §e§b§ethe tinkers tank is able to be expanded and can hold anywhere from 108 to potentially infinite buckets§f. The way it calculates how much liquid a tinker tank can store is by the amount of blocks in the structure, §bevery block in the structure counts for 4 more buckets§f. The only drawback to a tinker's tank is that Gregtech pipes do not autoexport from the drains in them, you must use a pump
§cEither 3x3 tank works for this quest

Do you not like your §esteam solid fuel boiler?§f It can be kind of annoying. So what if we used the §bsun §for §blava§f?

Make either the §asmall solar boiler §for the §asmall liquid boiler, §fthese can be used to turn other sources of power, like the sky and lava, into steam. Note that the solar boiler must be, you know, exposed to the sky for it to work.

With an Alloy Smelter... Well you can make alloys how novel is that. But wait! You can make many alloys!

For starters, you no longer need to melt bronze to alloy it, now you can turn three copper and one tin into bronze directly, no hassle required. But more importantly is §ared alloy§f. A combination of four redstone and one copper. This makes it somewhat costly, but is required for every steam machine moving forward.

Something vital for many mechanical circuits. §aRedstone§f. But it wont be easy to get...

First, you need to find §ea redstone vein.§f They're not super common, but you'll be sure to find one eventually. Next you'll need §ea cauldron§f which is a simple enough recipe right now.
Then you need to turn your §eRedstone Ore into Crushed Redstone Ore§b by breaking it with a hammer§f. It §cneeds to be an iron hammer§f since Redstone is iron mining level. Then you'll have to turn that crushed ore into §eImpure Pile of Redstone Dust §fby putting it with a hammer in a crafting grid. Finally, in a cauldron filled with water, you can throw up to a full stack of Impure Redstone Dust in to make pure Redstone. How nice§d.
You can do this same process with other impure dusts to get more bang for your buck, but with GT mining hammers it's not the biggest help in my opinion§f

For every steam machine after the alloy smelter and furnace (miner is not craftable) You'll need §apistons§f in some capacity. They're not something you can cheap out on, however.
The recipe is not very difficult, but it can be expensive when crafting a lot of them. But, they're required, and I'm sure you can tough through it.

Craft a Steam Macerator! This has quite a few uses but one you probably won't be using is it's ability to ore double. While, yes, it can double ore output, it's very slow at that and not efficient. I don't reccomend you double your ores with this. However it is still necessary.

Craft a Steam Compressor! This is used for multiple things, though the two most important is compressed fireclay (more on that later) and making metal blocks, yep, §cyou cannot handcraft any mineral into it's block form.§f You must use a compressor or some other GT machine.
It allows you to extract things! This is required, but not immediately.

It breaks rocks! Info is in the tooltip, place water and lava next to it and it will pop out cobblestone and possibly other materials.
I mean, you §lcan §0§fmake it, but I'll don't think you need me to tell you that it's not required.
With a Compressor you can now make blocks of iron, which is necessary to progress
Make a Steam Forge Hammer! This will allow you to turn three ingots into two plates instead of two into one! Very handy.

Has your Granite Anvil been breaking a lot? Well don't worry, the Ironclad Anvil has come to save you! It has eight times the durability of the granite anvil! How amazing! Wait... why is this required?

You aren't done with the Bloomery yet! Make some wrought iron! For this you need to put iron ingots through a bloomery and then hammer out that bloom, which §lonly §fworks on an Ironclad Anvil. Compress those nuggets back into ingots and you have a much stronger form of iron.

It can be used for better tools, mainly in one aspect.
Get up to Wrought Iron Mining Level! More ores open up for you now!
Make a barrel! Used for crafting Pryotech wines and §atannin§f. The barrel must have a lid on in order to start working, without a lid it is useless.

§aLeather§f is much more arduous to obtain now, so lets work to it!
By now, you should already know a little bit about butchery, and you should already have some pelts of some kind. Now you put it to the test. Combine those pelts with a knife in a crafting table to get scraped hide, and then soak that in a soaking pot to get a washed hide. Soak it again for tanned hide, and finally you can put it on a tanning rack for proper leather. You'll probably want to batch craft this stuff, since it takes a lot of time to make.

You may have noticed that while killing animals you don't get any products. Instead you get §a§ecarcasses§f. This is because you need to butcher the animals in order to get their insides.
For this you'll need a §abutchery table §fand some sort of §ahandsaw or knife§f. Handsaws are better at harvesting meat products, whereas the knives are better for harvesting things like lard and pelts.

With your upped mining level you can mine two specific ores, Calcite and Gypsum. You're going to end up needing both of these. Since they spawn so occasionally in their respective veins, you should use a hammer to obtain them.

Make some Firebricks! If you're going for the Primitive Blast Furnace (And well, what else would you be making with this) You will need 216 Firebricks which is, optimally, 54 blocks of clay and 54 bricks. Be glad I did the math for you.

With a little dash of calcite and gypsum in a barrel full of water, after some time it will make concrete! In it's liquid form it's not quite as useful as solidified concrete, but you can still use it for things.

This is a slow process, so you'll want multiple barrels making this.

Make the Primitive Blast Furnace and get some steel! The primitive blast furnace will only allow you to turn Iron into Wrought Iron and Wrought Iron into Steel, you cannot turn Iron into Steel, you must go through the intermediate. Luckily the PBF turns Iron into Wrought Iron very quickly, so this should not be an issue.

betterquesting:10.name:8: Oh Yeah.... You're Gonna Want Some More
betterquesting:10.desc:8: Steel is very important for a very long time, and right now you can ONLY use the PBF to make steel. While it's not slow at making steel, because you need Wrought Iron for it, you might want to make another blast furnace. But you're in luck! Since Gregtech multiblocks can §bshare sides§f. Meaning you need less firebricks for it to work! horray!

This quest is just to inform you that §aHigh Pressure Steam Machines §fexist, and run twice as fast as your regular steam machines. They're a good investment if you have the materials for them. You can also make high pressure versions of the boilers, which can come in handy.

The Alchemic Condensor and Retorts from Rustic are required for some entry level alchemy, used for brewing basic potions and other items. They need water in order to run.
The two retorts must be facing inwards towards the condensor in order for it to work.

Your first roots crops (Other than Baffle Cap or Wildroot) will be gotten with runic dust. These runic crops can be used for certain spells or, also, crafting recipes. The Tier 1 Crops are required for the Tier 2 Crops

Find some Rustic Bees! They can be found in beehives scattered throughout the world. Then make an apiary where they can boost crop growth from! They will also automatically make more bees when inside the apiary, allowing for infinite bees, BEES!!!!!!

They will also make honeycombs when in an apiary.

Make some of the Rustic Elixirs! The current ones available are the Elixir of Instant Health, the Elixir of Regeneration, the Elixir of Speed, and the Elixir of Night Vision. Each take a specific herb and some other ingredient in order to make.

§bChamomile is found in forests and plains

Cohosh is found in forests and plains as well

Wind Thistle is found on mountains

Mooncap Mushroom is found in jungles and caves

§fGood luck hunting!
Wooden crop stakes are used to hold certain crops in place, allowing you to farm things like chili peppers and tomatos.
Find any of the Rustic crops! You can look in the alamanac to find out where to find any of the crops.
Make a crushing tub! This can be used to crush down certain items into a crushed form. Like honeycombs into honey, or grapes into grape juice.

Make a brewing barrel and some mead along with it! This takes some liquid and after half a minecraft day will produce some brew afterwards. You can also increase the quality, reducing the chance of negative effects occuring. For more information, read the almanac.

Mead will give you the wither ward effect, which prevents you from getting the wither status. It only takes honey to make.

You've decided to start brewing, and you realized that you made a terrible concoction that is just plain awful. What a shame. At least it might have some other uses.

The mead required for this can be any quality.
Oh you made it even worse? What the hell is wrong with you!

So you finally got rid of that terrible smelling fluid, and you got a mushroom in return? The Baffle Cap is the only non-plantable roots crop, and must be grown like other large mushrooms. That is to say it grows into a large mushroom. It can be exposed to daylight and all, but it's not gonna go in your normal farm, it's a much bigger beast.

Some things can't be ground down by your gregtech mortar... or your artisan's mortar... You need a third mortar, a Roots mortar!
Once you have steel you can now make both the mortar and pestle from roots, which can be used to ground down certain items. From wheat to gravel, as a bonus, the mortar and pestle uses no durability! You can use it as much as you like.

To progress further into Roots, you'll need a certain type of dust that can't be made normally, you need some Runic dust. For Runic dust you'll need some Baffle Cap Powder, Stone Dust, Flint Dust, and a heap of some Steel Dust. grind it all together in a Mortar, and you will have a powerfully magical dust with many unique properties.

You must be exhausted. So much crafting, so much mining, so much smelting. You want some food, but you weren't able to make anything good before... Wait a minute, now you can make good food! The §b§aChef's Workshop§f allows you to make every Pam's Harvestcraft food, exploding your potential culinary options! 
You can't cook without utensils, so you also need to make a batch of some §ePam's cooking tools.§f But whatever, §bmore food!

Make a Grove Stone and perform the Grove Supplication ritual! This will empower the grove stone, attracting fey to your territory. These Fey can plant flowers, but they can also help power some certain crafts...

Your cloud berries can be used to make a special type of crafter, suited for more magical products. Of course, you still can't just craft with it, you'll also need the Fey Crafter to be near an empowered Grove Stone, which will attract Fey to it and help build your items. Once you have all of your items in the grid, shift-right click on it with a knife in order to start crafting.

With the Fey Crafter, you are now able to make the tier 2 crops! Same story with tier 1, can be planted and bonemealed and harvested just like any old crop. These crops should prove even more magical than the ones before it!
Craft a steel pickaxe or hammer! Doesn't matter to me, you just need steel tools.
Steel pickaxes/hammers are able to mine obsidian, find some extraneous lava and make sure to grab some of it.

Elemental Soil is a block that plants can grow on, and when a plant is grown on it not only can it not be trampled it also has a special effect depending on the type of soil! Specificities of what type of soil does what can be read in JEI, as well as how to make them.

Some say that the Fey like those who have a special pair of shears and will reward them virtuously for using them on some animals. While Runic Shears can provide some material benefits, most often you will get either magical leather or a magical feather. With varying uses.

You can also obtain eggplants with it.

With the power of the Fey you can imbue stone with the magical runic powder you made before, making a sturdy stone with very enchanting properties...
Additionally, you can further enhance it into a strong form of obsidian, with perhaps more magical applications.

Perform the Creature Summoning Ritual. This ritual will allow you to use resources in order to summon creatures, the ingredients for a creature must be placed on catalyst plates around the altar, and thus are a requirement for the ritual to run. It can accept anywhere from 1-10 catalyst plates, depending on the amount of items required for the recipe.

Rubber is a pretty useful resource, it's stretchy and bender, and also an insulator! But rubber doesn't spawn naturally in this world... Maybe the Fey can help?

Now only if you had sulfur...
Use the creature summoning ritual in order to summon a Twilight Raven, and then promptly kill it for it's feathers. You heartless asshole...

betterquesting:10.name:8: I Only Meant To Stay A While
betterquesting:10.desc:8: The Twilight Raven came from a place not of this world, another world that is far more magically powerful than this one. Using the Fey you can get a bit of the dirt from that world, and maybe, if you threw that bit of soil into a pond surrounded by flora, you could open up a door to that world. Good luck in there. It will not be easy.

Craft a Magic Map Focus and the subsequent map! This tool will give you a map of a large area around the spawn, but the special part of the magic map is that it has specific markers for every single important structure of the Twilight Forest! From Hydra Swamps to Urghast Towers, it will show them all.

Another interesting point of Twilight Forest world generation is that every single boss structure + The Final Castle §lwill, §fwith no exception, be on a singular map. This does not mean every biome will be on one map, as you may discover eventually, but every major structure will be on one map, so you should not have to craft more than one!

In the Twilight Forest, powerful magic energy flows throughout. Because of this, potent forms of wheat and beetroot can be found in this dimension. Explore, and find the tier 3 roots crops!

Spirit Herb will spawn in the Firefly Forest and Twilight Forest, Wildewheet spawns in the Oak Savannah

Woah! A Boss! Your first major battle, I hope you're ready!

The Naga is a boss that spawns in Naga Courtyards when you approach the center. It is a large snake like boss that is very strong around its body, but weak at its head and tail. It's fairly strong and fast, but I think if you'd have a ranged weapon, you'll do just fine against it! Grab those scales and be done with it!

Find §aLiveroot §funderground and alloy it with steel in order to make §aIronwood!§f The first of the Twilight Alloys. 

Liveroot looks like a green version of the regular root blocks. If you are running low on it, you can make more in the Fey Crafter.

Put some rubber pulp through an extractor and get the rubber extract! Alternatively you can make it by a crushing tub, but to a much less effective extent

Still can't make rubber though.

Since you now have steel, you can make a furnace! But not just a regular furnace, an actual furnace! Not any weird seared furnace or anything, but an actual Minecraft Furnace. It's not too useful, but it's a bit easier to craft in the late game than stone kilns, so that's something.
Beat the Naga and unlock the final crops from Roots! Stalicripe and Infernal Bulbs

Wildroot is said to be the sapling of a much larger and much older tree, and while it will not grow into that tree on its own, with some encouragement it just might. Using the pyre ritual of "Wildroot Growth" on a fully grown crop of wildroot will grow it into it's much larger, former, tree self. Chop it down and get it's wood!

Combining every single crop into one powder proves to be successful venture. Perhaps nothing will ever be able to beat this powder, it is perfect.

It can be used to light a Nether Portal, but additionally, it has uses in making small mana powder and, perhaps most interestingly, some Fey recipes. This dust has some inherent magical properties, and thus can be used to make some recipes that normally take Fey crafting without any Fey at all.

The transmutation ritual will turn a block or item or any other number of things into another one once every five seconds while running. To function it requires a ritual stone on a 3 block high pillar as well. Check the Almanac for more info.

Runic dust is so old school. No matter what you can do it seems to stay as a dust, and will never be usable as anything but. Luckily, you've found a potential way to make a very powerful type of ingot, something that may turn out to be quite versatile. By performing the transmutation ritual on blocks of ironwood, they turn into "Runic Metal", which is strong, durable, and quite magical. Go and Make some posthaste!

That Twilight dimension has you thinking of worlds, other worlds. Perhaps there is a world that is the complete opposite of this one, that is a burning hell that looks inescapable.

The nether is a tough place! Bring plenty of good food and armor with you. Maybe consider the Sylvan armor from Roots? This pack has the nether portal constructed differently, instead of obsidian and flint and steel, it's now Nether Portal blocks and the previously crafted Perfect Powder.

Now go to hell!

betterquesting:10.name:8: Gomu-Gomu no We're Done With This Joke!
betterquesting:10.desc:8: By crushing sticky resin in a crushing tub you can get a little bit of rubber pulp, but, more importantly, you can also get §aglue§f. Glue is a required crafting component for many circuit components, and this is the only way to get it in the early game.
Now that you can access the Nether, try getting some gold! It spawns in Nether Limonite veins sporadically, but is the only way to get native gold at this point in time.

Grab some sulfur! Sulfur veins in the nether contain itself, obviously, pyrite, and spahlerite, which is useful later but for right now can only be processed into Zinc.
Much like with redstone, you'll want the dust, and thus will have to do the crushing method all over again.

Using Raw Resin Extract and Sulfur, you can put it in an alloy smelter to get rubber pulp! This is, a very important ingredient to coating wires, the issue is that you need it to be in a liquid form to coat wires. What a shame...

You can smelt Rubber Pulp in a Crucible, and then pick it up in a tank or drum from Gregtech, after doing that you can put it into a basic worktable, and then craft yourself some very useful covered cables! These are important for making LV machines and some circuits, and also, of course, they will transfer GTEU.
Using steel plates you can make molds, these allow you to make certain things in the alloy smelter! Namely glass tubes, which take the ball mold and you'll be using a lot of eventually.
Make a Vacuum Tube! This component is vital in making your first circuits, so you'll want to make quite a few of these eventually (Maybe not yet though, wires are expensive)

Using glue, you can now make two other important circuit components, the coated circuit board and resistors! Surrounding the coated circuit board in cables will get you a proper circuit board as well, perfect for putting some components to!

After all this time, and all this crafting, you can finally make yourself an Electronic Circuit, the first LV Circuit! Putting all the components you've made together creates a valuable start to all your electronic futures.

You'll want to make a few of these once your wires become cheap, you go through circuits fast.
Congrats! You can make your LV Machine Casing- Wait why the hell make this but not the hull?

Oops! Just because you have an Electronic Circuit doesn't mean you get electronics, dummy! No, in order to get to LV, and get the LV hull and LV components, you need an engineer's workshop. Even more of an undertaking!

Luckily, none of the recipes are changed for the LV components, you just need the workshop to make them all. In fact, expect this to be a pattern. Initially, you cannot craft any of the electronic components normally, you're always going to need to do something extra for it.
Craft your hull and motor, and say hello to LV!
Electricity is kind of useless without a way to make it, so make a steam turbine! This generator will turn your boiler-produced steam into fully functioning electricity! Perfect for the kids!

The wiremill is an IMMENSELY helpful machine that will allow you to turn a single ingot into two wires!!! That's some crazy increased returns right there. If you don't make this first, you're kind of an idiot. No hard feelings.

You want components? I got components. The Electric Pump, Conveyor Belt, Piston, and Robot Arm are all used in quite a large amount of gregtech machines, and three of them have some useful utility purposes of their own (especially since item conduits are disabled)
Want to get glue AND resin simultaneously? Make the centrifuge! Perfect for the amount of circuits you're going to end up needing

Living Tools are a particularly useful set of tools from Roots! The main appeal of them is that they will automatically repair themselves overtime! They can also be tiered up to even more powerful or faster repairing tools.

Eh?

Make the Roots Bow items.

The Assembling Machine is a very powerful machine that allows you to make items easier, or even make completely new items!

You'll absolutely want this machine! It's required for quite a lot of recipes.

Using a forge hammer, you can turn 3 ingots into 2 plates, which is okay, but we can do better. The bending machine will allow you to turn one ingot into one plate, a perfect ratio.

There's some other things here, like foils and etc, but the plates are most important.

You can't turn one ingot into two rods yet, but you can do better than just one rod. A Lathe will output some small dust as well as a rod by running through an ingot. It can also be used to makes lenses.

Craft a Distillery! The LV Distillery has limited uses since it cannot process oil, but it's still able to make some useful appliances.

§cAlternatively (And more likely) Use the brewing machine with talc.
Process some Creosote Oil (Or other types of oils are allowed) and get some lube!

That sphalerite you grabbed earlier can be smelted into zinc, if you turn it into some foils you can even lubricate them! Perfect for machines that need just a little bit of tweaking-up. You get more bang for your buck with your foils if you use a metal bender as well. Doubly useful!
Has paper been a little too costly? Do you want another way to make treated planks? Go and craft a chemical bath! But don't bathe in it!

Using the lubricated foils, soldering alloy, and many other tools inside of an assembling machine, you can make the key components to every gregtech multiblock, §athe modular inputs/outputs!§f Those being the §6§einput/output bus §b(which works with items), §ethe input/output hatch §b(which works with fluids), §eand the energy/dynamo hatch §b(inputs/outputs energy respectively). §fWith all of these components you can make §a§dany gregtech multiblock you desire!§f Well, as long as you have §cthe controller §ffor it.

Make all of the modular I/O's and start getting into the big leagues! You'll also need the §amaintence hatch §fand §amuffler hatch §ffor multiblocks.

Begin your avenues in chemistry by making a chemical reactor! This simple device will allow you to react two substances together! Quite handy.

What you'll likely be using it for this early on however is producing rubber, since this machine makes rubber much more efficiently than the alloy smelter.
Craft a Fluid Solidifier! It allows you to... solidify fluids? Honestly these machines are real simple to write out flavor text for.

betterquesting:10.name:8: How I Learned To Stop Worrying And Love Rubber
betterquesting:10.desc:8: Making rubber is pretty expensive right now, so lets do it better! By solidifying molten rubber (from your chemical reactor) into sheets (using a fluid solidifer) you can use that to coat wires directly! No more stupid crucibles!
Allows you to mix things!

Stibnite ore in the nether provides you with antimony when smelted down. Putting that, lead, and some tin in a mixer gets you a strong blend called soldering alloy! It's perfect for stitching things together, especially for an assembler.

You'll mostly be using the liquid, so use a fluid extractor and make that as well.
It's like the steam extractor, but uses electricity!
Want to make beer? Well you can't. But you can brew other things with the basic brewery! Including lubricant if you put enough talc to it!

In Low Voltage you have access to only a limited amount of multiblocks, and only one power generation option. That doesn't mean these mutliblocks are going to be a pushover, they're still very expensive and very useful to have.

The multiblocks you have access to because of this tier are:

§9Large Bronze Boiler §d(Specialized Steam Generator)§9
Industrial Steam Engine §d(Multiblock Power Generator)§9
Electric Blast Furnace §c§d(Required for Progression)

The Steel Multiblock Tank holds 4x the amount of liquids as the Wooden Multiblock tank, storing a total of 1000 buckets!

Automatically outputs from a valve at the bottom, same as the wooden tank.

Do you hate crafting clay? Want to make bricks faster? Of course you do! Using Wildwood planks you can make a farmer's workshop, which allows you to not only craft pam's seeds, finally, it also allows you to make some recipes slightly easier. It's a handy worktable.

The §aSteam Oven§f and §aSteam Macerator §fare two multiblocks that will process multiple items in parralel and function, effectively, as better forms of the Steam Furnace and Steam Macerator. To use them, they take Steam Input Buses and a Steam Hatch, where the steam is put into the steam hatch.

To make any multiblock, you obviously need a way to control it. That's why you need to make the LV Control Module! This device is used in every multiblock controller, and even though it's expensive, you'll need it!
§3Description To Be Added
§3Description To Be Added

You like steam? You like having a §lLOT §l§rof steam? Well look no further than the §a§aLarge Bronze Boiler§r! This multiblock is miles faster than any of your current sources of steam, producing almost a §efull bucket of steam each tick at full efficieny. §fIf you plan on using steam at all in the future §b(And especially the Industrial Steam Turbine) §ryou will practically need this.

The Boiler is very modular, especially with the output hatches. The diagram in JEI only shows one model, and the required items in this quest shows another, although you can experiment with many different designs! Whatever is the best at making steam for you. You can also use different types of fuels instead of just coals for this, but coal is probably going to be your main way of firing it up at the moment

§cDO NOT PUT FUEL IN IT WITHOUT WATER OR ELSE THE BOILER WILL EXPLODE
§3Description To Be Added
§3Description To Be Added
§3Description To Be Added

What???? A Boss right after???? Well, it's not required immediately after, but soon you'll have to face the Twilight Lich in the tall towers around the forests and savannahs, kill him and take his bones!

Is it even spelt right?

§aChrysopoeia §fis the last spell in roots you will get for a while, it allows the user to turn objects into other ones, like rotten flesh into leather, or copper into iron. You may get use out of it for turning §eSteel Dust directly into Runic Dust §fand §f§eRunic Dust directly into Runic Metal§f. Runic tools are pretty good for what it's worth, and are a significant upgrade from Steel, and this spell cheapens the process.
Use the... previous roots spell to turn perfect powder into §amana dust§f! You'll need this for some early botania actions, but there will be a quickly way of getting mana dust shortly!
§9§3Description To Be Added
§3Description To Be Added
§3Description To Be Added
§3Description To Be Added
§3Description To Be Added
§3Description To Be Added
§3Description To Be Added
§3Description To Be Added
§3Description To Be Added
§3Description To Be Added
§3Description To Be Added

All of this work has not gone to waste, it is time to make the leap and bound to MV, Medium Voltage, at 128 EU per tick. Of course, the road to it is long and winding, so make haste and not waste!

The machine casing is fairly easy, as Aluminium should be in your wheelhouse at this point and the recipe is nothing special. The electronic components may be a little more convoluted however, as they require crafting an unpowered version before injecting it with Hydrogen in order to get it to function and be used as a component in any machine. Don't ask how that works though, I'm not sure. The Good Electronic Circuit is your next hurdle, but not a terribly difficult one either. They take 3 circuits for each one though, so you may want to look to finding a cheaper way to make them... Food for thought, I guess.
§3Description To Be Added
§3Description To Be Added

The regular §echarcoal pit§f is limited in what it can do, so make the new §arefractory one§f instead!
Unlike the regular charcoal pit, the §brefractory pit needs to be surrounded by refractory blocks on all sides,§f§f making it significantly more expensive. But, in return, it will allow you to §eprocess coal into coke in it§f as well, and get valuable byproducts from doing that.
Same rules as the old charcoal pit. Refractory collectors can be put in the bottom and refractory drains can take the fluids out of 9 of them.
§3Description To Be Added

As we are now entering MV, your own ability to use Gregtech and your wit will become increasingly important. There wont be quests for many individual machines from now on, make whatever machines you think will help you progress! You definitely need the components first though, get that settled.
§3Description To Be Added

betterquesting:10.name:8: A Place For Birds To Perch
betterquesting:10.desc:8: §3Description To Be Added

The Start of Gregtech - Other Worlds. A new adventure awaits! In a hostile, yet gentile world.

This will get you acquantinced with most of the earlygame, and will set you up with your initial metals and machines.
Your first glances at true gregtech! Steam Machines and ULV, what wonders await...
Get acquantinced with plants and alchemy as you play with Roots and Rustic
The first "Other Worlds" in the modpack! Travel to the Twilight Forest, burn in the Nether, dive into the Mystic, and finally end up at the End.
Welcome to electricity! Machines in this tier use 32 EU/t, and you mostly only have access to Steam Power
Filled With every multiblock you'll ever need!
Machines use 128 EU/t and things get even more expensive! Now you're really into things
Finalize the power of produce by jumping into the waters of Botania.
